Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PG-1 analog 10 (Synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, XXA, 1S=S, UCSS1a; XXD1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid SUBSTITUTION, pig cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature.Author: Lai JR, Huck BR, Weisblum B, Gellman SH. 2002
Literature.Title: Design of non-cysteine-containing antimicrobial beta-hairpins: structure-activity relationship studies with linear protegrin-1 analogues.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (83.33%) toPG-1R: 28%, W=G: 17%, V: 11%.Chemical modification:  central proline is a D-amino acid.Activity: active against E. coli JM109 (MIC 6.3 ug/ml), B. subtilis BR151 (MIC 3.1 ug/ml), penicillin-resistant S. aureus 1206 (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), and vancomycin-resistant E. faecium A634 (MIC 3.1 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (150 mM), NaCl-insensitive:B. subtilis (150 mM), NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus (150 mM), NaCl-insensitive:E. faecium (150 mM).
